text.0: agni wellkindled bring the gods for him who offers holy gifts.
text.2: son of thyself present o sage our sacrifice to the gods today.
text.3: sweet to the taste that they may feast.
text.4: dear narāśaṁsa sweet of tongue the giver of oblations i.
text.6: agni on thy most easy car glorified hither bring the gods.
text.8: strew o ye wise the sacred grass that drips with oil in order due.
text.10: thrown open be the doors divine unfailing that assist the rite.
text.11: for sacrifice this day and now.
text.12: i call the lovely night and dawn to seat them on the holy grass.
text.14: the two invokers i invite the wise divine and sweet of tongue.
text.16: iḷā sarasvatī mahī three goddesses who bring delight.
text.17: be seated peaceful on the grass.
text.18: tvaṣṭar i call the earliest born the wearer of all forms at will.
text.19: may he be ours and ours alone.
text.20: god sovran of the wood present this our oblation to the gods.
text.21: and let the giver be renowned.
text.22: with svāhā pay the sacrifice to indra in the offerers house.
